comments:
Hi,
I have installed Eclipse 3.1 M7 recently. I was working on a java project and
then switched my workspace to an old java workspace that I created with Eclipse
3.0.2. After switching the work space, Eclipse closed the current workspace and
restarted with new workspace (as usual). However, as soon as it restarted and
loaded the new workspace it gave me an error dialog that has the following message:
The Procedure entry point lib_intl.fprintf could not be located in the dynamic
link library intl.dll

I have attached a screen snapshot along with this bug. Here are the environment
details:
Eclipse command line: C:\java\eclipse31M7\eclipse\eclipse.exe -VMargs -Xms128m
-Xmx256m [Since I start it from a windows shortcut I dont know if it has throws
any exceptions.]
OS: Windows XP SP2

Here is what I got in /.metadata/.log file:

After looking at it, it seems that it might be an SVN plugin problem. But I want
to make sure that it is not an eclipse problem. Please let me know.

Thanks

Kamlesh

Created an attachment (id=21475)
intl.dll Problem while starting eclipse 3.1 M7

It is indeed related to Subversion. The mentioned DLL is used by that plug-in.

Can you always reproduce this if you use the restart feature of Eclipse (ie.
File > Switch workspace..., but reopening the current workspace)?

Do you pass any special properties to Eclipse when launching (such as
java.library.path)?

Also, for a session where this errors happens, please provide the value for the
following multi-line system properties (About...>Configuration Details):

eclipse.commands
eclipse.vmargs

This is a SVN bug and probably I need to upgrade to a newer version or else I
will file a bug there. Sorry for the invenience. I have noted the point about
session details. I will provide that whenever I file a new bug. Thanks for the
quick response.

traces.message: Javahl client adapter is not available
